intro: Pappochroma, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plants are characterized by their milky sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine. They typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or white. Pappochroma species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid environments.
